ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I further developed my skills to speak and express my thoughts in the Korean language through reading, writing, and speaking.
Better understanding of conversational Korean
More advanced grammar, vocabulary, more speaking practice, more knowledge of Korean culture, etc
I learned more complicated/advanced grammar structures and improved my written and oral skills.
Intermediate to Advanced grammar constructions, a large amount of vocab, and gained writing, conversational, and presentational skills.
I was able to really expand on my knowledge and love for the Korean language.
I learned a significant amount of Korean grammar and vocabulary.
Much stronger command of Korean fluency, basic grammar forms and vocabulary.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course could involve more of a speaking component; however, I am grateful for its emphasis on grammar, vocabulary, and reading comprehension skills.

Strengths: The class atmosphere is great! Lim SSN is so kind and a wonderful teacher.
Weaknesses: Some guidelines are not very clear. For example, the weekly posting and the guidelines for certain assignments were not made very clear to the class.

Strengths: Lim Ssn is amazing and kind. The class dynamic is excellent and really conducive to learning. Everything is explained really well Weaknesses: Maybe a hot take but I do wish we were exposed to more new grammar and vocabulary. It still feels like actual native speech uses many more grammar points and words than we know and I wish we saw more of that. I also liked the few times we used actual Korean content (on Youtube etc) as a learning tool and wish we did that more (maybe even a majority of the time....)

Strengths: Lim ssn!!! The class was well-organized, and Lim ssn was able to foster a really nice class dynamic.

Weaknesses: none

Strengths: This is a class where you can learn Korean in a pressure free environment.  Mistakes are learning opportunities, and the class and professor are all extremely supportive.

Weaknesses: None.  This is the most fun I've had in any class at Yale.
PHENOMENAL CLASS WITH PASSIONATE INSTRUCTOR!!!!

I thought the course was great in terms of structured learning and going over topics and themes in an orderly fashion. I wished the course had involved more speaking, particularly in improvised/impromptu scenarios, as that is a skill I feel could be worked on more. I would also love to do more listening exercises whenever possible.
Im Ssn. is an incredible teacher and the pacing of the course was flexible and well-thought-out. The tests, in-class worksheets, and instructor lectures felt adequately challenging and balanced.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, especially for anyone who is looking to continue their Korean from L1 to L4.
Yes!

If someone wants to learn some Korean and make many new friends absolutely! The class was such a gem and something I really looked forward to everyday. I definitely still think that the best way to learn a language is not in a class but rather through engaging with cultural materials directly, but this class was definitely worth it because of the comfortableness I feel with certain grammar points and how nice the atmosphere was .

Yes.  If you are in L3 and you have the opportunity to continue on, you absolutely should.  Not only will you learn a ton and have your Korean improve drastically, but due to the kind and supportive learning environment, you'll gain confidence in your abilities too.
ABSOLUTELY, WITHOUT A DOUBT!!!!
I would recommend the course as a good means to practice your Korean in a classroom environment that is friendly and geared towards the happiness, success and learning of the students.
Yes!
Yes! It's a great course to expand and solidify your Korean.
